data.decision: Next phase is usage telemetry: log which injected skills were actually useful, then automatically promote expansions that get used, demote those that don't. This is how Duro becomes "earned defaults" not a fancy filing cabinet.
data.rationale: Without usage telemetry, the system is just static configuration. With it, the system learns per-project taste and the right context gets pulled automatically. The practical test: if Duro nails design drills with supporting skills auto-pulled, we're done.
data.context: Freeze architecture now. Run 15-20 real tasks. Log context pack + which parts used. Tune ONE thing: expansion set + foundational list. Otherwise just polishing engine while car is on blocks.
